text:
Hi Lasma, great to e-meet you!

How are you?

I thought I’d kick off the conversation with a bit more info about me.

I started my journey into VFX when I was back in school. Then, after a number of years doing other things, I went to an expo of Weta Workshop’s stuff which rekindled my desire to pursue my career in VFX again. (I love The Lord of the Rings! :male_mage:)

I re-acquainted myself with photoshop and eventually took a course at Escape Studios in London. Since then I’ve worked at various studios in London on both film and TV projects as a Compositor.

I am here to help with your showreel, give feedback or generally answer any questions really. Please feel free to ask anything :grin:

I can see you are currently in an internship in Bournemouth. How are you finding that?
Hi Jon, great to e-meet you too!
I've seen some amazing showreels from Escape Studio students! How was it there?

Yup, I started in September and it's a 11 month contract. It's going well, my main and probably favourite part of the job is helping with demonstrating in VFX classes and sometimes live-drawing if I'm not assigned anywhere. Plus it's great to have time to improve my work before starting in the industry, especially because I've heard from multiple people that it's hard to get a first job straight as a DMP artist.
I'm sorry if I'm ever slow with answering, there are quite a lot classes I have to be present for.
Can I ask, do you prefer to do TV or film projects more? And have you ever had to to a matte painting for any of them? :blush:

My current showreel looks like this: <https://vimeo.com/371621204> but I'm working on improving the shots and once I'll be done with that I'm hoping to make one or two more projects with a more classical landscape matte-painting/ building extensions to add in it.  What do you think of it so far?
